Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A, $P_A = 1 \times 10^5 P_a$ and $V_A = 3 L$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state B, $P_B = 1 \times 10^5 P_a$ and $V_B = 4 L$

Note the red line in the figure, from state A to state B, the volume becomes larger, the gas does work externally, and the work size is the area enclosed by the red line, that is $W_1 = P_A \cdot \Delta V = 100 J$
